intro: Natsiatum gamosepalum, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, or white. The plant has a woody stem and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing in sandy soils. Natsiatum gamosepalum plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
